meanings.definition: A book bound with rigid protective covers.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading hardcover books because they are more durable.
meanings.sent2: The library had a wide selection of hardcover novels.
meanings.sent3: When the hardcover book fell off the shelf, it made a loud thud.
meanings.sent4: Her love for hardcover books was as strong as the protective covers themselves.
meanings.sent5: The hardcover binding of the book gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To bind a book with rigid protective covers.
meanings.sent1: She learned how to hardcover her own manuscripts to protect them.
meanings.sent2: The bookbinder will hardcover the novel for the author.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hardcover his notebook with cardboard, but it didn't look professional.
meanings.sent4: The author's words were carefully hardcovered by the skilled bookbinder.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the machine hardcovering the book echoed in the workshop.
